title: 108_s1495
content: Consolidation of life insurance companies with other companies is permitted. Amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 includes changes to definitions and subsections related to includible corporations and special rules for insurance companies. Amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 includes changes to definitions and subsections related to includible corporations and special rules for insurance companies. Sections 1504(b)(2), 1504(b)(4), and 1504(c) are being replaced with section 1504(b)(3) in various sections of the Code. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is being amended to update various sections by replacing references to specific subsections with new ones. The changes will apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2003. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is being updated to replace specific subsection references. This change will apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2003. Additionally, there is a phase-in of the application of certain losses against income of insurance companies. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is updated for taxable years starting after December 31, 2003. A phase-in provision allows affiliated groups with domestic insurance companies to offset consolidated net operating losses under certain conditions. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is updated for taxable years starting after December 31, 2003, allowing affiliated groups with domestic insurance companies to offset consolidated net operating losses. Treasury will consider any loss not absorbed in carryback periods against taxable income in determining consolidated taxable income, with the unused portion available as a carryover in subsequent years. The applicable percentage for this calculation will be determined accordingly. The applicable percentage for determining consolidated taxable income will be determined according to a specific table. The applicable percentage for determining consolidated taxable income for specific taxable years is as follows: 2004 - 40%, 2005 - 50%, 2006 - 60%, 2007 - 70%, 2008 - 80%, 2009 - 90%. Additionally, there is an election available for pre-2010 years for affiliated groups with insurance companies. The Act allows affiliated groups with insurance companies to elect to treat them as non-includible corporations. Any consolidated net operating loss cannot be carried back before January 1, 2004. The Act allows affiliated groups with insurance companies to elect non-includible status. No group shall terminate due to this section. Basis adjustments for subsidiary stock reflect preconsolidation amounts. The Act allows affiliated groups with insurance companies to elect non-includible status without termination. An automatic waiver is granted for the 5-year waiting period for reconsolidation to corporations previously includible but later deemed nonincludible due to becoming a subsidiary of a non-includible corporation.
